data.question: What are metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) primarily composed of?
data.answer: MOFs are coordination polymers in which metal atoms or inorganic clusters are bridged by polyfunctional organic molecules.

data.question: What property is suggested to be more likely in MOFs with extended inorganic hybrids compared to coordination polymers?
What effect does increasing the temperature and pH have on the condensation of inorganic species in cobalt succinates?
data.answer: It increases the condensation of the inorganic species.

data.question: True or False: The phases that occur at lower temperatures tend to be isostructural with other CoII and NiII coordination polymers.
What is the effect of increasing the ratio of NiII in the synthesis of MIL-9?
data.answer: It leads to the formation of four crystalline phases with different structures.
